intro: Lastrea indochinensis, commonly known as the Indochina lastrea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically clustered in terminal spikes and come in shades of red, pink, or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
